name: Tourism Impact
description: Tourism can bring economic growth and cultural exchange but can also lead to environmental degradation and strain on local resources.

name: Animal Entertainment
description: Animal entertainment often involves confining animals and forcing them to perform, leading to stress and ethical concerns.

name: Eating Meat
description: Eating meat can provide essential nutrients and cultural significance, but it also raises ethical and environmental concerns.

name: Free Public Transport
description: Free public transport can increase accessibility, reduce traffic congestion, and help the environment.

name: Universal Basic Income
description: Universal Basic Income can provide financial security, reduce poverty, and promote economic stability.

name: Compulsory Retirement Age
description: Compulsory retirement age can ensure opportunities for younger workers but may also overlook the value of experienced employees.

name: Space Exploration
description: Space exploration drives scientific innovation, expands human knowledge, and inspires technological advancement, though it requires high investment.

name: Alternative to Fossil Fuels
description: Alternatives like solar, wind, and hydro energy reduce carbon emissions, combat climate change, and promote sustainable development.

name: Free University
description: Free university education increases access to learning, reduces student debt, and promotes social mobility, though it requires strong public funding.

name: One-Child Policy
description: The one-child policy aimed to control population growth but led to social, demographic, and ethical challenges such as aging populations and gender imbalance.

name: Remote Work
description: Remote work offers flexibility and work-life balance but can also cause isolation, reduced collaboration, and blurred boundaries between work and personal life.

name: Nuclear Energy Source
description: Nuclear energy provides large-scale, low-carbon power but raises concerns about radioactive waste, safety risks, and long-term environmental impact.

name: Violent Video Games and Real-Life Violence
description: Violent video games are argued to either increase aggressive behavior or serve as harmless entertainment with no direct link to real-life violence.

name: Banning Sugary Drinks
description: Banning sugary drinks aims to improve public health and reduce obesity but raises concerns about personal freedom and government overreach.

name: Global Responsibility
description: Global responsibility emphasizes shared accountability among nations and individuals to address global challenges such as climate change, inequality, resource management, and humanitarian issues through cooperation and collective action.

name: Promoting Nationalism
description: Promoting nationalism can strengthen national identity, unity, and pride, but it can also lead to exclusion, intolerance, and conflict if taken to extremes.

name: Climate Change
description: Climate change refers to long-term changes in global temperatures and weather patterns, largely driven by human activities, leading to environmental damage, extreme weather events, and risks to ecosystems and human life.

name: Drinking Age
description: The legal drinking age is intended to protect public health and safety, especially among young people, but it also raises debates about personal freedom, maturity, and cultural differences.

name: Right to Vote
description: The right to vote empowers citizens to participate in democratic decision-making, ensuring representation, accountability, and the expression of public will in governance.
